text: Events in the year 1929 in Turkey.Türkiye'nin 70 yılı, Tempo, İstanbul, 1998, pp 44–47 ==Parliament== * 3rd Parliament of Turkey ==Incumbents== *President – Kemal Atatürk *Prime Minister – İsmet İnönü ==Ruling party and the main opposition== * Ruling party – Republican People's Party (CHP) ==Cabinet== *5th government of Turkey ==Events== *21 January – Great fire in İstanbul *24 March – Bankruptcy law *23 April – To commemorate the opening of the Turkish parliament was established as the Children's Day. *1 July – First intercity telephone line between Ankara and İstanbul *11 October – The maintenance of the Turkish battleship Yavuz was completed *25 October – First international air mail (Between İstanbul and Berlin) ==Births== *7 February – Aysel Gürel, lyricist *13 February – Kenan Erim, archaeologist *18 February – Ertem Eğilmez, film director and producer *1 March – Nida Tüfekçi, musician *3 March – Mithat Bayrak, wrestler *29 April – Ferit Tüzün, composer *5 May – Ayhan Işık, actor *7 June – Basri Dirimlili, footballer *11 June – Ayhan Şahenk, business man *24 July – Gülriz Sururi, theatre actress *9 August – Abdi İpekçi, journalist *15 September – Mümtaz Soysal, academic, lawyer and politician *10 October – Ayten Alpman, singer *13 October – Adalet Ağaoğlu, novelist *30 November – Doğan Babacan, referee ==Deaths== *1 January – Mustafa Necati ( born in 1894), minister of education and the founder of Public schools for the new alphabet (Nation's schools) *15 September – Fehime Sultan (born 1875), Ottoman princess ==Gallery== File:Kemal Ataturk soviet embassy.jpg|Kemal Atatürk File:Ismet Inonu portrait.jpg|İsmet İnönü File:Mustafa Necati Uğural.jpg|Mustafa Necati File:Fehime Sultan.jpg|Fehime Sultan ==References== Category:Years of the 20th century in Turkey
title: 1929 in Turkey
